subject: Photography
title: Cloud Storage and the Photo Archive
description: Learn Cloud Storage and the Photo Archive in one minute.

hook.text: In 2023, humans took an estimated 1.8 trillion photos. Where do they all go? Mostly, the cloud.

buildup.text: Cloud services like Google Photos, iCloud, and Amazon Photos store billions of images on remote servers.

discovery.text: AI in cloud services can search photos by content: 'dog,' 'beach,' 'birthday' ‚Äî without manual tagging.

twist.text: Cloud dependence means if a service shuts down or changes terms, your photo archive could vanish overnight.

climax.text: The paradox: we take more photos than ever but may preserve fewer. Digital files are fragile without backups.

punchline.text: We take more photos than ever. We may keep fewer.

quiz.question: What is a major risk of storing all photos in the cloud?
options: Service shutdowns or policy changes could make archives inaccessible
Cloud photos are always low quality
Cloud storage is more expensive than film
